intro: Vittadinia disticha, commonly known as the common vittadinia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas, thriving in a variety of soil types. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Vittadinia disticha produces small yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, which attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
